unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: Interpretation of Confidence Interval
question_text: A $95\%$ confidence interval of $(2.6, 4.2)$ was created for a study based on a regression model looking at SAT scores and the number of college acceptances for a random sample of students. Which is the best interpretation below for this confidence interval for the slope of this model?

choices.text: We are $95\%$ confident that the interval from $2.6$ to $4.2$ contains the slope of the true regression line. Because zero is not contained in the interval, we have evidence to show that an association exists between these two variables.

We are $95\%$ confident that the interval from $2.6$ to $4.2$ contains the slope of the true regression line relating a student's SAT score and the number of college acceptances.
